body:
/kind bug
When user requests an encrypted PV in AWS storage class and refers to an invalid / non-existing encryption key, then AWS provisioner happily creates the PV, but the backing AWS EBS volume does not exist.

Create class:
```shell
$ kubectl create -f - <<EOF
apiVersion: storage.k8s.io/v1beta1
kind: StorageClass
metadata:
  name: fast
provisioner: kubernetes.io/aws-ebs
parameters:
  type: io1
  iopsPerGB: "50"
  encrypted: "true"
  kmsKeyId: arn:aws:kms:us-east-1:555555555555:alias/nonExistingKey
EOF

storageclass "fast" created
```

Create a PVC:
```
$ kubectl create -f - <<EOF
kind: PersistentVolumeClaim
apiVersion: v1
metadata:
  name: fastclaim
  annotations:
    "volume.beta.kubernetes.io/storage-class": "fast"
spec:
  accessModes:
    - ReadWriteOnce
  resources:
    requests:
      storage: 3.5Gi
EOF

persistentvolumeclaim "fastclaim" created
```

PVC is dynamically provisioned:
```
$ kubectl get pvc
NAME        STATUS    VOLUME                                     CAPACITY   ACCESSMODES   STORAGECLASS   AGE
fastclaim   Bound     pvc-4dc6cf13-6000-11e7-bb6f-0e908fa925c2   4Gi        RWO           fast           1m
```

But the backing AWS EBS does not exist:
```
$ kubectl describe pv pvc-4dc6cf13-6000-11e7-bb6f-0e908fa925c2
Name:           pvc-4dc6cf13-6000-11e7-bb6f-0e908fa925c2
Labels:         failure-domain.beta.kubernetes.io/region=us-east-1
                failure-domain.beta.kubernetes.io/zone=us-east-1d
Annotations:    kubernetes.io/createdby=aws-ebs-dynamic-provisioner
                pv.kubernetes.io/bound-by-controller=yes
                pv.kubernetes.io/provisioned-by=kubernetes.io/aws-ebs
StorageClass:   fast
Status:         Bound
Claim:          default/fastclaim
Reclaim Policy: Delete
Access Modes:   RWO
Capacity:       4Gi
Message:
Source:
    Type:       AWSElasticBlockStore (a Persistent Disk resource in AWS)
    VolumeID:   aws://us-east-1d/vol-0655743bad08b10ed
    FSType:     ext4
    Partition:  0
    ReadOnly:   false
Events:         <none>

$ aws ec2 describe-volumes --volume-ids=vol-0655743bad08b10ed

An error occurred (InvalidVolume.NotFound) when calling the DescribeVolumes operation: The volume 'vol-0655743bad08b10ed' does not exist.
```
